text: Hey all - I can’t get my menu to work right. It doesn’t seem like I have anything telling the submenu to close when I hover over it, but it does. Does anyone know how to remedy?
are you doing it with css or javascript?
i just have it embedded in the page withe the {% menu %} tag
let me ask a different way:
there are 2 ways to control the hover action 1. is with javascript 2. is with css :hover - do you know which one your code is using so that we know where to look?
when i hover, i don't see any menus appear... but i do see a menu flash when i click resources, then navigate to another page
if you click on ‘software outsourcing’ and then mouseoute of of - it will close the flyoout
the menu is controlled by javascript embedded in the page from the {% menu %} hubl tag i am thinking
the event is coming from here: <http://www-accelerance-com.sandbox.hs-sites.com/hs/hsstatic/keyboard-accessible-menu-flyouts/static-1.3/bundles/project.js>
i just don’t understand why the menu works this way on a lot of my pages but not here.
also noticing that the other ones open on hover, whereas this page's submenus only open on click for me
I'm pretty sure the js might be tied a little to the wrapping html as well, just using the menu module might not be enough here... you might have to use the whole global module from the other page
thanks - i’ll give it a try now
